text: Costimulation of human <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells with <extra_id_0> LFA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> B7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induce distinct effects on AP-1 and NF-kappa B transcription factors .

We have earlier shown that stimulation of human <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells with SEA presented on Chinese hamster ovary ( CHO ) - DR transfectants coexpressing either <extra_id_0> B7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> LFA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> resulted in distinct cytokine profiles .

text: Gel-shift analysis demonstrated that stimulation of <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells with CHO-DR and staphylococcal enterotoxin A was sufficient to induce significant amounts of NF-kappa B binding proteins , whereas induction of AP-1 binding proteins required costimulation .

<extra_id_0> LFA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced moderate levels of AP-1 , but did not influence the levels of NF-kappa B , while <extra_id_0> B7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> costimulation strongly induced both AP-1 and substantially enhanced NF-kappa B binding proteins .

The CHO-DR / <extra_id_0> B7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> LFA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> triple transfectant induced a further increase in AP-1 and NF-kappa B binding proteins compared with the double transfectants .
The level of Oct-1 binding proteins remained similar in all samples .

Super - shift analysis revealed that the NF-kappa B complex of costimulated <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells contained large amounts of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , substantial amounts of <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and marginal levels of <extra_id_0> c-Rel <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proteins .

The AP-1 binding proteins contained <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> Jun-D <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> Fra-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but marginal amounts of <extra_id_0> Jun-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> c-Fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Our results indicate distinct effects of <extra_id_0> B7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> LFA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> costimulation on the activity of AP-1 and NF-kappa B .

These may partly account for the differential effects of <extra_id_0> B7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> LFA-3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> costimulation on <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
